title: Build Text-Scale-Adaptive Layout
description: Create a profile header that adapts gracefully to large text sizes.
instructions: Build a ProfileHeader widget that displays a user avatar, name, title, and action buttons. At normal text sizes, show horizontal layout. At large text sizes (>1.5x), switch to a vertical layout that stacks elements. Requirements: (1) Check text scale factor using MediaQuery, (2) Horizontal layout at normal sizes with avatar, text, and buttons in a row, (3) Vertical layout at large sizes stacking avatar on top, then text, then buttons, (4) Icons should scale with text size, (5) Ensure minimum touch targets of 48x48.

hints.text: Use MediaQuery.textScalerOf(context).scale(1.0) to get the current scale factor
Create separate methods for horizontal and vertical layouts and switch between them based on scale factor
Use .clamp() to limit how much icons scale, and wrap IconButtons in ConstrainedBox to ensure minimum 48x48 touch targets

commonMistakes.mistake: Using fixed widths that cause overflow at large text sizes
commonMistakes.consequence: Text gets clipped or causes layout overflow errors
commonMistakes.correction: Use Flexible/Expanded and softWrap: true to allow text to flow naturally

commonMistakes.consequence: Icons become visually too small relative to large text
commonMistakes.correction: Scale icon sizes with textScaler but clamp them to reasonable limits
